meanings.definition: The quality or state of being talkative or garrulous.
meanings.sent1: Her chattiness during class discussions made her a favorite among classmates.
meanings.sent2: I enjoy her chattiness; it makes our long car rides more entertaining.
meanings.sent3: At the party, her chattiness about her pet goldfish had everyone laughing.
meanings.sent4: His chattiness was like a bubbling brook, never running out of stories to tell.
meanings.sent5: The room was filled with the delightful chattiness of children playing together.

meanings.sent1: The meeting was unproductive due to the constant chattiness of some attendees.
meanings.sent2: I find his chattiness annoying when we are trying to focus on work.
meanings.sent3: The teacher tried to control the chattiness in the classroom by introducing a new game.
meanings.sent4: Her chattiness about the weather was like a broken record, repeating the same information.
meanings.sent5: The room was filled with the mindless chattiness of people discussing the latest gossip.
